column5: I've been looking at the Hughes River 8" Shaker, anyone have any experience with these, colour suggestions and so on? I wouldn't mind some info good or bad prior to purchasing one.

they are good baits todd.  nice action on them and well built.. they should be for the price.  if you like throwing gliders, and dont mind spending the coin, you will like how they work.  there a less expensive alternatives that work too.  don't bounce one off a rock
You back in town yet Todd?   And BTW, great baits. I have a couple Hugheys and Shakers. Thumbs up!
Yep I'm back!  And lookin to spend some money.
Is the action of wood gliders that much better than plastic?   I liked plastic for better hook-ups (as well as price and durability) but have heard that wood is better....?
Who let this cat out of the bag?  How are things Jef?  This is beginning to sound like old home week!!!
OMG  Those are pricey!!!!!!  Now what can that bait do that all the baits under $25 can't...?really?
I don't fish for muskie but checked these out of curiosity 82$ what the...
Wow, a nearly two year old post from my cousin brought back to life and TEP is even in there.  You two still alive?

Wooden baits are generally hand made...No two pieces of wood are exactly the same, therefore, wooden baits have to be hand tuned...You have to pay for the time and skill that is required. There is also something quite special about using hand crafted items, the human touch?   A link to our pioneer past? I don't know... If you feel that hand tied fly's, and custom fishing rod are worth the extra cost, you already understand...If you don't, well, no explanation is really possible!
Hey Roy I know how you can fund the new playground for the kidlettes.   Art
So does that mean todd is not back in town anymore
Bet he spent all his money by now too.
